channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘I’ve struggled in every way’: My brother passed away and I’m $28,000 in debt. How do I get out of this mess?
item.description: “Has my grief affected my situation? Looking back, I think it did.”

item.title: As a nurse, I’ve seen people use their power of attorney to take advantage of their parents. It would chill you to the bone.
item.description: “Even if someone has millions of dollars in retirement, that won’t keep them from being trapped in the hospital.”

item.title: Busted by the em dash — AI’s favorite punctuation mark, and how it’s blowing your cover
item.description: AI is brilliant at polishing and rephrasing. But like a child with glitter glue, you still need to supervise it.

item.title: OpenCUA’s open source computer-use agents rival proprietary models from OpenAI and Anthropic
item.description: The open source framework provides the data and training recipe for building powerful computer-use agents that challenge proprietary systems.

item.title: ‘I learned a hard lesson’: My ex-husband gambled away our $900,000 life savings. Do I use my 401(k) to buy a home?
item.description: “I have about $80,000 in my 401(k) and $10,000 in savings.”

item.title: Do you have a lottery addiction? With the Powerball jackpot now at $700 million, this man’s story may be telling.
item.description: Adam Osmond gambled away a fortune on lottery games, but eventually sought help.

item.title: ‘I can only rely on me’: How do I protect myself from my parents’ nursing-home bills?
item.description: “I do not expect or need anything from my parents.”

item.title: How automation and farm robots are transforming agriculture
item.description: Farm robots can reduce labor shortages by automating tasks like planting, harvesting, and weeding, while also supporting sustainable practices. The po...

item.title: Meet the researcher hosting a scientific conference by and for AI

item.title: Copley Controls releases nano servo drives for mobile robots
item.description: New drives operate from 9 to 90 Vdc input voltage and deliver up to 140 A of continuous current, providing exceptional power density and efficiency. T...

item.title: QPT launches motor drive testbed for collaborative robots
item.description: MicroDyno demonstrates the performance of ultra-high frequency GaN-based motor drives. The post QPT launches motor drive testbed for collaborative rob...

item.title: Waymo to test robotaxis with safety drivers in NYC
item.description: Waymo can operate eight autonomous vehicles, with safety drivers, in NYC until late September, when it can apply for another permit. The post Waymo to...

item.title: MCP-Universe benchmark shows GPT-5 fails more than half of real-world orchestration tasks
item.description: A new benchmark from Salesforce research evaluates model and agentic performance on real-life enterprise tasks.

item.title: Don’t sleep on Cohere: Command A Reasoning, its first reasoning model, is built for enterprise customer service and more
item.description: It looks to be a strong release. Benchmarks, technical specs, and early tests suggest the model delivers on flexibility, efficiency, and raw

item.title: Meta is partnering with Midjourney and will license its technology for ‘future models and products’
item.description: Details are scarce on how much if any money is involved. And what does it mean for Midjourney's previously announced plans for an enterprise API?

item.title: The case against humans in space
